title: Secondary Summary Container
reference-overview: The Secondary Summary Container is meant to provide the user with a high level overview of various subsections of data. For example, a user could have a number of tasks which could be broken down into a set of statuses. The secondary summary container would provide the number of total tasks broken down into the various status states.
reference-usage:
The Secondary Summary Container should be used on interior or secondary screens when:

  • You want to convey a combination of a view of metrics with a pre-defined filter.
  • You want to visually convey a variety of options.
reference-details:
• Number of sub-sections can be a variable.
  • Each section should be the same size.
  • Titles can wrap to second link.
  • Each section has a rollover color
  • Red to indicate a negative number or an elevated status.
  • Yellow is the default rollover color.
  • Each subsection can be a link to more details or just a number.
reference-mobile:
• The font size will increase.
  • Each individual section of the summary container will wrap and stack on top of one another vertically.
  • The hover state will not display.
